reviewText: Keeping Up Appearances is a really funny look at the pretentiousness of a middle-aged British married couple. Between them, in episodic domestic episodes, they give a very funny portrait of the British middle class way of life of a few years ago. It's a send-up, of course. But, there are many gems of truth in each episode. The dialog and characters are real. I found it very funny. As a middle-aged expat, I found Hyacinth a true nostalgic trip back to a life once remembered. Try an episode. You won't be disappointed

I'm glad I am able to buy this show on DVD.  I'm no longer able to watch it on PBS and, of course, it's convenient to pop in the DVD and watch the show whenever I want.  I recommend both box sets.  My favorite episode in this box set is "What to Wear When Yachting".

If you like Britcom's as I do then this is a must see. It's light hearted and quite funny. I tend to watch them over and over again and never get bored. One of the things I've noticed watching this and other Britcoms is how much we Americans and the Brits are so much alike. It's easy to relate to the situations.

MONEY....THANKS.  HIGHLY RECOMMDED.

"Keeping Up Appearances" was a 44-episode, British TV sitcom that ran for five seasons between 1990 and 1995, with several specials filmed through 1997. The show's primary character was Hyancinth Bucket (Patricia Routledge), who always pronounced her last name as 'Bouquet' to make it sound as impressive as possible. She was obsessed with making her family appear as affluent and upper class as possible, which involved keeping her home immaculately clean and bragging to everyone about any new acquisition. While Hyancinth believes that she is admired and well respected by her piers, the reality is that no one wants anything to do with her.  Her husband, Richard Bucket (Clive Swift), does not share Hyacinth's obsession, but he accommodates her as best as he can. Unfortunately for Hyacinth, her various plans to improve their station in life are often sidetracked by issues from her less affluent sisters or her senile father. The people that are most intimidated by Hyacinth are her next-door neighbor Elizabeth Hawksworth Warden (Josephine Tewson) and her brother Emmet Hawksworth (David Griffin, who appeared in the second season onward). The local church vicar, Michael (Jeremy Gittins), and his wife (played by Marion Barron) also try to avoid Hyacinth as much as possible.
Hyacinth's three sisters live to varying degrees of affluence. Daisy (Judy Cornwell) and her blue-collar husband Onslow (Geoffrey Hughes) live in a row house that is in dire need of repair, with a wrecked car parked out front and an unkempt interior. Hyancinth's unmarried sister Rose (played by Shirley Stelfox in 1990 and Mary Millar between 1991 and 1995) lives with Daisy and Onslow and enjoys spending time with many men to the chagrin of Hyancinth. Hyancinth's only affluent sister, Violet (Anna Dawson), is rarely seen, but Hyacinth often speaks with her on the telephone. However, Violet's husband Bruce (John Evitts), who is also rarely seen, often has a penchant for wearing women's clothes to Hyacinth's embarrassment. Their senile father (George Webb) lives with Daisy and Onslow, and has a tendency to run away and get himself into all sorts of trouble.
This 4-DVD set includes the following:
* Volume #5, entitled "Everything's Coming Up Hyacinth", includes all seven episodes from the third season.
* Volume #6, entitled "Some Like it Hyacinth", includes all seven episodes from the fourth season.
* Volume #7, entitled "Living the Hyacinth Life", includes the first six episodes of the fifth season and interviews with Patricia Rutledge and Clive Swift.
* Volume #8, entitled "Hats Off to Hyacinth", includes the last four episodes of the fifth season and the 1997 special "The Memoirs of Hyancinth Bucket".
Though "Keeping Up Appearances" is not as well known in the U.S. as "Absolutely Fabulous" (nor is it as outrageous), it is a very good example of British comedy. Overall, I rank this 4-DVD set with a rating of 5 out of 5 stars.

Well done for the great and wonderfull DVD collection.  I have bought both sets namely Hyacinth in full bloom and Hyacinth springs eternal,  I cherished all the films with great amusement and laugh. I suggest this series to everybody who likes British comedy at its best.  However and may I be subject to correction,  Where is the episode THE ROLLS ROYCE which I assumed is in series five?  I don't know the answer why its lacking and I think its a great pity not having it in my set, perhaps someone could anser my question.  But all in all great series great crystal clear dvd and very good sound as well. Buy all I recommend.
I love this show. It gets funnier each time you watch. The DVD itself was  excellent condition better than described. Absolutely pleased all the way around.
excellent quality and price

Family like Onslow, Daisey, Rose and Father.  Naturally Hyacinth would produce an offspring such as Sheridan.  Perfect script, perfect acting, simply perfect.

I have written this review on my new slim line computer that's does not have any hand painted Periwinkles anywhere at all on it.

Jumping between seasons is seamless, except for the first season with original Rose (original, not the real Rose). Season to season, all the actors look the same...thanks for the consistency. I love that the characters never 'evolved' as time passed.
Worth viewing this timeless classic, remember its "Bucket" LOL.... Onslo is hysterical, poor Daisy.  Great cast of characters, one you will treasure for sure.
A great series to cure whatever blues you may have.  The cast is amazingly funny and the writing is witty.
It is a delightful, comedic, yet satirical farce on snobbery in today's world.  It's enjoyable, clean comedy at its finest.  Thank you BBC and all involved.

This show never gets old!  It's Patricia Routledge at her very best and an amazing cast of great actors that pull their own weight.  British comedy at it's best and twenty years from now I will still be watching it.  Don't miss it.
hyacinth is really funny and she is always up to something.  my favorite episode is the waterside picnic with all her neighbors.
this show is timeless it is so funny i could watch it over and over again and I have lol

My daughter lives in England and I first saw this show over there.  I could watch every show over and over.  I got it for my Kindle Fire HD.  I'm going to watch it on my next flight to England.  This show is so funny.  You will laugh from the beginning to the end of each episode.  I love it.

I have seen nearly every episode of  Keeping Up Appearances many times. However, the writing and acting in the series is so good, that they are amusing time and time again.
Hyacinth and Richard are Great Britain's answer to Lucy and Ricky. I suspect the show will be in circulation for years.

Hyacinth Bucket (pronounced Bouquet) a suburban housewife is sure that it's only an accident at birth that she is not royalty.  Eager to show the world that she too is a respectable member of the community with comedic results.  Well worth watching over and over.

This series is simply brilliant!  It plays here on the local public station, but is usually out of the order originally broadcast.  There were episodes I never saw until I started streaming the entire series.  I absolutely love Patricia Routledge as our Hyacinth, and poor Richard, and of course Onslo.  There is an excellent cast of supporting characters that will quickly become endearing to you.  If you enjoy good comedy, and are a fan of Britcoms, this is definitely a must see. And remember, it's Bouquet - B,U,C,K,E,T!!!
My daughter and I enjoy this series so much. The relationships in this family are so funny. I think most people can relate to it. And our Hyacith is fantastic. What an actress!

This show is absolutely hilarious! I love British comedy and this one tops the charts for me. The sisters - all of whom are named for flowers...and all of whom wreak havoc in their own rite - are truly a sight to see and are funny to watch! Love it!

Very entertaining and funny. Clever humor and animated comedy with interesting characters that you can enjoy watching and relate to.
We love Mrs. Bucket, even my 3 year old daughter can talk like her! It's so funny, and not too much bad language

Get ready viewers!  Hyacinth Bucket (pronounced "Bouquet") is at it again in this 5th season of "Keeping Up Appearances".
Patricia Routledge is superb as the aspiring elitist who contends with the problems inherent in dealing with lower class relatives, a daft father. Routledge is wonderful at physical comedy, and her over-the-top character is balanced by the quiet, obedient husband, Richard, whom she henpecks constantly.  Wonderful, funny, a "must see" series!
The main reason we have Amazon Prime is for English TV. Many UK shows shown wish more. The best TV.

I just love the wit of the English. Sure beats American TV today. We promote so much that has lost meaning in
our wonderful country today.
I have reviewed this show before and still love it!  It is really funny and I wish I could see Patricia Routledge in real life to see what she really is like.

This show is full of great characters, but Hyacinth takes the cake.  Really fun to watch! Some of the very best brit humor.
Very upbeat and fun to watch. Just have to smile at the effect Hyacynth has on her family, friends and neighbors.
This is by far my favorite series of all time.  Full of laughs no matter how many time you watch them.
this is a great show, if you like British comedy.still, this a very good and silly show to pass the time.
Hyacinth and Richard never disappoint !!! The Buckets are the best funny couple along with their neighbors, family and clergy you just can't avoid having a great time with them.

I first ran into these by mistake -- when I regularly watched television. I did not really know what they were about. Nor had I ever seen ANY of the actors/actresses prior to then -- but BOY! Did I ever come to love this series!!!

Life is full of pretentious people but Mrs. Bucket (that's "Bouquet") is one of the wackiest. With her off the wall family, loving (but stressed out) husband, and kind next door neighbors --  her efforts to appear to be what she is not only end up causing her to become more isolated from the very people she wants most to impress (not her family, husband or immediate friends).

Despite that, hers is a character you come to care about as she lands herself in one mishap after another.

Similar to "I Love Lucy" (but not exactly as I am not convinced that anyone or anything could truly compare to it) this is an enduring comedy series which one can watch over and over again.

For new watchers and old ones - I highly recommend it!!! :)

This series and the episodes included never grow tiring or stale; I always laugh no matter how many times I watch it.  The earlier episodes are the best in my opinion, so if you're not captivated by the 1st 5 episodes, then no need to continue on.  Worth it for a great laugh!
This show was so funny.  I couldn't wait to watch each episode .  It was very disappointing to fine out that there wasn't a season 6 to watch.  Each season got funnier than the last.

My mother used to watch this show and I would hear her laughing through it all. I was so excited to find it on Amazon and have been watching the shows on a regular basis. It is good wholesome comedy and it streams to my laptop and kindle very easily. Thankyou!!

I love this show.  But I am also a BIG fan of BBC comedy. This one tops my list! Hilarious!

Love it.  Have watched each show over and over.  Love the characters and enjoy seeing residential and country side areas in England.  Love the British accents.  This show helps he laugh at the ridiculous side of life for the different classes in England and the lengths' the main character will go to achieve aristocratic acceptance.
old, superb, always worth watching it either on TV re-runs or my Kindle Fire, strongly recommend it to relax and enjoy

Patricia Routlege is a hoot in this series.  Her character demonstrates to what lengths some people will go to prove they are a better class of people then they really are.  Through her funny behavior she shows how ridiculous and futile that is.

It's been quite a few years since I discovered this program on BBC, and I now own the complete collection on DVD. Patricia Routledge, quite simply, gives the most hilarious performance as the socially correct and pretentious Hyacinth Bucket (Bouquet in her parlance). No matter how much she knows about or attempts to practice with regard to etiquette, her motley assortment of dysfunctional family members offers up many opportunities to embarrass Hyacinth and she spends a great deal of time trying to avoid her sisters, the trampy Rose, unstylish and untidy Daisy, and lazy brother-in-law Onslow who live in a state of blissful disregard and indifference for their rundown and perpetually disheveled home and rattle trap car. Conversely, Hyacinth loves to tell everyone about her sister, Violet, who lives in a high end house and owns a "sauna, Mercedes, and has room for a pony" even though Violet and her husband Bruce are just as dysfunctional as the less well off members of the family. No one is safe from Hyacinth's annoying behavior and obliviousness to just how much she irritates everyone who knows her, especially her next door neighbors, the milkman, the postman, and the vicar. Hyacinth's husband, Richard, is the long suffering spouse that everyone feels sorry for. Filled with the unique British humor and Routledge's stellar performance, this series is bound to provide many laughs for those who watch. I highly recommend.

Like most British comedy Keeping up Appearances is full of humor that is based on the interplay of the characters.  It's one drawback is the recurring themes.  Hyacinth is tremendously entertaining at first.  But over time, her lines became jaded. Even the reactions of the other cast got old.  It's still a funny show that merits watching.  I just wish the writers had been more creative instead of repeating the same gags.
My family and I LOVE this program! But it's awful how they didn't end the series properly. The Rolls Royce episode is cringe-worthy!
So darn funny. Absolutely love these epidsodes. Patricia Routledge is fantastic. Looking for more episodes. Will keep looking.  British Comedy at it's best.
Speaks to a very specific time, place and mindset but well-done and approachable by anyone who's interested in people-watching.  Clever dialogue, charming cast.
I fell in love with this series when I saw it on PBS. I watched and DVRed this show every time it came on. When it was taken off the air I missed it. Thank you so much for carrying this DVD set.
The last five or so minutes of this show are among the funniest in TV history. Patricia Routledge is unsurpassed in her ability to carry off physical humor.

Love it! Buy it! SO FUNNY!!!

H. "Richard, mind the cows."
R. "Cows? What cows?"
H. "The one's in the field dear." ;)

I used to watch this on PBS with my mother back in the day. As I understand it, it's still running in select markets, and for good reason, it's highly entertaining! I used to love the time spent with my family as a kid whilst watching this show, sitting down and enjoying the cheeky comedy provided. It was a lot of fun in fact, and rewatching it brings back a flood of good memories. So obviously my opinion is colored because of that, but it really is a lot of fun to watch it! It's silly though, really silly. This is my absolute favorite season. Check it out, I dare you. In fact I triple dog dare you.
This series is funny on how not to act if you want to impress anyone. Not sure why I was captivated, but I was! Love all the characters, hate to see it end :)

Keeping up Appearances for us is the very best of English comedy.  All the principle players are perfect and each has a great resume' in their background.  This is a show you can watch over and over and still enjoy with a lot of laughs.

this the second time I have been asked to evaluate this set. DOES ANYONE ACTUALLY READ THESE EVALUATIONS???? I stated previously that the sets NEVER ARRIVED!!! If Amazon could please check into the problem I would deeply appreciate it. Don Martin
I received the product in one day perfect condition , very professional , would order again in a heart beat .
Nobody does Comedy like Patricia Routledge! I watch these dvd's over and over with my kids and grandkids and they love them.

This is an extraordinarily hilarious set of four DVDs featuring the non-stop talents of Patricia Routledge and cast. Hyacinth's resounding voice and unbelievable escapades make me glad that I am not her neighbor! I do love her character, however, and truly enjoy watching every one of the series in this set.
I love this program. I think their second season was the best, though all of them are wonderfully warm and absurd!

I absolutely love British comedy, and while I understand this is pretty much an "old person's show" in Great Britain, I think Hyacinth Bucket is fantastic (and I'm only 34).  Half of the entire series included in this multi-disc collection.  Brilliant cast, superb writing, and definitely rewatchable - again and again and again.  Great quality picture and sound which beats the quality you get from most public television stations.  A must have for the Britcom buff.
I really enjoyed this collection.  Each DVD had 6 episodes, so there was plenty to watch.  A long time favorite of mine and my family.

I don't really care for sit-coms but once in a long while something refreshing comes along. I bought the whole series right off the bat. Its one of the few things I'll watch over and over again because the show is such a lift.
I Purchased this item for a Father's Day present for my husband.  He loved it.
Keeping Up Appearances - Hyacinth Springs Eternal Set (Vol. 5-8) It is one of the greatest TV series every filmed/taped. It is like MASH; it can be viewed 400 times and never ceases to amuse.

Though not really rabid, Emmet and the rest of the cast will do nearly anything to avoid Hyacinth, the "Bucket Woman." Patricia Routledge is perfect in this series as Hyacinth Bucket ("it's pronounced 'Bouquet'"...) as a social climber who will do anything to be noticed by the upper class. Well known for her candlelight suppers, Hyacinth ventures into more novel entertaining venues in these episodes. One of my favorites of this set is "Riparian Entertainments," which has a deliciously wicked nautical twist. Interestingly several of the other episodes in this set also have a nautical back story.

In these episodes Elizabeth and Emmet develop into central roles; Elizabeth gets ever more nervous around Hyacinth and develops an unusual drinking problem, while Emmet goes to any lengths to hide from Hyacinth ("She'll sing at me!") The rest of the cast is perfect as well: Rose is sworn off men (...again...sadly Mary Millar recently passed away,) Daisy and Onslow manage to offend Hyacinth with their lower class sensibilities and "bone-idleness," while simultaneously being the most likeable members of the cast. I especially enjoy seeing Onslow in his sweater vest or Green Bay Packers t-shirt reading "Principles of Condensed Matter Physics." The supporting cast members are fabulous as well: the postman and milkman are wonderful in their attempts to avoid Hyacinth, and the Vicar and his wife are delightfully resourceful in keeping Hyacinth at arm's length as well.

These DVD's are the last half of the series and largely cover the leisure years after poor Richard (played to perfection by Clive Swift) retires. I don't envy his retirement one bit no matter how many golf outings, dress balls, or estate sales he gets to attend...but I do especially like the outing where Hyacinth and Richard go horseback riding with Emmet, an expert rider.

This is a great series and a great boxed set. There are several extras ranging from public service announcements to outtakes, all of which are worth watching. Most of all, though, sit back and revel in the good humor and hilarity ranging from the incredibly subtle to the sublimely ridiculous. I highly recommend this set to anyone with a sense of humor. It's one series you can watch repeatedly and never get tired of.

I really enjoy the whole "Keeping Up Appearances" series.  I originally caught the show on TV by mistake and have been a fan since.  This show is great!  If you like classic sit-coms, you will appreciate this one. Maybe a bit pricey, but worth it.
Love the series.
if you like comedy you will like this

I love this series.  However it is not available to us, Keeping Up Appearances, fans in America.
Hyacinth and her family are so enjoyable
Love Hyacinth Bucket and all the rest.  Can't always catch them on PBS- now I have my own.
I got this for my grandma for Christmas. She is going to LOVE it!  Very funny.
Patricia Routledge is simply great and the script is good, so the combination is hilarious. Use this for stress relief, and for better health (laugh is the best medicine)
